results.content:
The course gave me insight in many new functions and tricks. However there are many things to improve. For example more details in explanation and especially more examples of usage.
Thanks for your course.
results.content_html:

results.content: I learned a decent amount about the new standard - but if the delivery of the course were a bit more forgiving (maybe not quite a fast on explaining the concepts, examples at least "leaning" toward real world usage & maybe a bit more on the "whys" around the usages of the new additions to GO WITH the "whats" and "hows")
results.content_html: I learned a decent amount about the new standard - but if the delivery of the course were a bit more forgiving (maybe not quite a fast on explaining the concepts, examples at least "leaning" toward real world usage & maybe a bit more on the "whys" around the usages of the new additions to GO WITH the "whats" and "hows")

results.content: Nice training that gives a good overview of the new features in ES6. The audio however could be better. Sometimes it sounds like one sentence is recorded in multiple iterations and then stiched together. This makes it exhausting to listen to the audio.
results.content_html: Nice training that gives a good overview of the new features in ES6. The audio however could be better. Sometimes it sounds like one sentence is recorded in multiple iterations and then stiched together. This makes it exhausting to listen to the audio.

results.content: Many of the sections went by too fast and were not well explained. In particular, the lecture on “spread operators” and the lecture on “proper tail calls” (which was only 58 seconds long and failed to explain what a tail call is). I found myself pausing the videos and reading documentation on MDN to fully understand some of the concepts, before moving on.
results.content_html: Many of the sections went by too fast and were not well explained. In particular, the lecture on “spread operators” and the lecture on “proper tail calls” (which was only 58 seconds long and failed to explain what a tail call is). I found myself pausing the videos and reading documentation on MDN to fully understand some of the concepts, before moving on.

results.content: The examples for WeakMap, Map, Proxy and Generators are a bit non-sense, would expect a little bit more of a use case because it's such a specific new feature. It was a bit confusing.
results.content_html: The examples for WeakMap, Map, Proxy and Generators are a bit non-sense, would expect a little bit more of a use case because it's such a specific new feature. It was a bit confusing.

results.content: Nice course, but if you add more detailed content, that will be good

results.content: It is recommended for those who want to know about EcmaScript 6. It summarize useful features in ES6.
